result.execSummary:
The defendant John H Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay costs; DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory financial obligations. Court will WAIVE any non-mandatory costs and surcharges due to defendant's indigency status. FAILURE TO PAY ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor and your civil rights are suspended until they are restored.
- No further violations of the law.

- Follow all rules of probation.
- Assessments and any treatment programs deemed necessary.
- Cooperate with WCS monitoring.
- Other counseling needs to be determined.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
INITIAL APPEARANCE code was not entered and case remained in FILE STATUS.  Clerk contacted counsels via email to resolve.
INITIAL APPEARANCE code had to be entered prior to the plea/sentencing date of 8-31-2016 to be accepted by CCAP.

Defendant John H Walton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant John H Walton in custody.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 7
To the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Defendant has been accepted by WCS Clinic for monitoring.  Statements by counsels and defendant,
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 year in the House of Correction; credit for 240 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR  with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-Assessments and any treatment programs deemed necessary.
-Cooperate with WCS monitoring.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
*The court will WAIVE any non-mandatory costs and surcharges due to defendant's indigency status.
-Pay all mandatory financial obligations.
-Provide for DNA sample and pay costs; DNA surcharge
FAILURE TO PAY ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
As a convicted felon you may not carry or possess any firearms or body armor and your civil rights are suspended until they are restored.
FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief 
            Pretrial Credit

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant John H Walton not in court, in custody.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John H Walton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant John H Walton in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7,  in Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Case remains calendared for scheduling on 08/08/2016 at 8:15am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John H Walton in court with attorney Margaret E Mccandless.  Defendant John H Walton in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
BRANCH 17 for BRANCH 25
 Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Collins report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Collins report.  Parties stipulate as to  qualifiions of Dr. Collins to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Debrah Collins.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Collins, and testimony of Dr. Collins, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court found the defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  The defendant shall be given 23 days of credit for precommitment incarceration.  The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference on 05-02-2016 at 8:15 in Branch 38.    Parties advised as of February 1, 2016, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Exhibit List- Return of Doctor's Report on 01-27-2015, received and filed. tk
Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Branch 17 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 25. Parties notified and reported to Branch 17 forthwith. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Doctor's report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant John H Walton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant John H Walton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
